NHAI has  engaged External Professionals and Young Professionals as per the provisions of the policy circular dated 21.06.2017. 2 Certain issues were raised by the concerned cadre controlling  division, Finance Division and field offices relating to entitlements, statutory deductions, equivalency in the existing hierarchy etc:_ of External Professionals and Young Professionals engaged under the policy circular dated 21.06.2017. 3_ The issues have been examined and following clarifications are issued to the Policy Guidelines dated 21.6.2017 referred to above: A_ Clarifications on procedure relating to claims for payments, statutory deductions and issue of assets: Sl. No Issues Clarifications Claims of EPs YPs for release of payment_ Leave account (CL & Sick leave shall be maintained by the respective division at HQ PIU wherein EP/YP is posted. On approval of their controlling officer /concerned CGM; the bill shall be directly submitted to Finance Division for disbursement. The head where monthly remuneration will be The remunerations payable is not booked ie. Salary expenses or Professional salary wages, but   professional charges Expenses? and hence _ may be booked under Professional expenses consultancy charges; after recovery of TDS (Income Tax) uls 194-J of the Income Tax Act, 1961_ EPF deduction in the case of EPs and YPs_ The EPs and YPs are not entitled for any benefit under EPF and hence, the remuneration is to be without deducting any contribution towards EPF (iv) Issuing of IT assets and other allied IT issues: Such issues shall be decided by IT Division like e-mail ID, FTS ID etc to Advisors, Jt a5 per functional requirement; Advisors, Consultants and Young Professionals Page of 2 paid paid
